A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
This movie was a slaughterhouse for the ideals and characters built up over the course of a decade.

Many claim that "as a standalone movie it would be 4 or 5 stars." Even THAT is false. The plot is illogical. There is nothing likable about the characters. The movie was overly long and just flat out boring. I was checking my watch to see when I could leave the movie that the 5 year old sitting in front of me could have easily written.

If we get past the butchering of Luke\, the death-defying rocket Leia\, the trashing of Kylo Ren's character development\, cheesy humor that only has place on Disney Junior\, and all of the plot holes\, this movie feels just like a political statement by the libs at Disney.

Almost all of the bad guys were white males. Almost all of the good leaders were women. I like to see a fair 50-50 movie. You know\, equally male and female. This wasn't that. I felt strapped down with 50 gallons of new-age feminist agenda shoved down my throat. It's a shame.

For as long as I can remember\, I've loved Star Wars. Like millions of others\, I had the movies\, read the books\, played with the toys and games\, and I was excited to have Disney continue it on. It had a lot of potential. I don't know how they could have done this poorly. It's astounding.
